snippet: Harvard and other top private universities are spending heavily to upgrade museums and build more artistic centers.
abstract: Elite campuses nationwide have emerged from recession riding a multibillion-dollar wave of architecturally ambitious arts facilities; trend is exemplified by radical overhaul of the Harvard Art Museums by architect Renzo Piano, which cost roughly $400 million; boom comes at a time of unprecedented criticism of how colleges teach and how they spend money, amid push to measure what students learn.
lead_paragraph: Harvard and other top private universities are spending heavily to upgrade museums and build more artistic centers.

headline.main: On Elite Campuses, an Arts Race
headline.print_headline: On Elite Campuses, an Arts Race
